results.title: Teaching nutrition: cross age tutoring
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit
results.brief_description: A short program for teachers to view before they become involved in nutrition education. It uses the cross age tutoring approach but the message is equally important regardless of the teaching strategies to be used. For both primary and secondary teachers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerben Cath, International Video Books and Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit

results.title: Teaching machines and programmed learning
results.creator_credit: James Learmonth, Digby Duncan and Gateway Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film explains the use of teaching machines in the classroom. It demonstrates simple and complex machines and defines programmed learning into two types - linear and branching.

results.title: Teaching machines and programmed learning
results.brief_description: B.F. Skinner explains the theory of programmed learning; Arthur Lumsdaine describes its application in machines and materials available; and Robert Glaser speaks of the implications of these for education. The advantages of the method are that individual students work at their own rate, progress is made apparent and the ease of learning gives encouragement.

results.title: Teaching judo. Part 2. Introductory techniques
results.brief_description: Following Judo Part 1 the film is screened entirely with ground work (newaza). It does not concentrate on technical details but allows the novice to try the skills encouraging him to perform it his own way. Technique comes from movement experienced in the initial stages.

results.title: Teaching judo. Part 1. Introductory techniques
results.brief_description: Shows how a group of schoolboys using ordinary gymnasium equipment can be introduced to judo. Object is to produce full active participation, early experience of the throwing movement, and full movement range for each individual. A logical progression through various developing stages.

results.title: Teaching english by the situational method: an advanced structure
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the method of teaching an accelerated English course using the situation method. Includes English drilling, concept development and contrastive drills.

results.title: Teaching crutch walking
results.brief_description: Shows how the physical therapist teaches the bed patient reconditioning exercises; how to teach the patient to walk in a walker; how to teach the various methods of crutch walking - two-point, four-point, and swing; how to teach the patient to sit, rise and climb stairs; and the safety factors involved in crutch walking.

results.title: Teaching adults to read
results.brief_description: Based on Tom McFarlane’s book of the same title, the film sets out to demonstrate the wide range of reading activities that can be used. Intended for use on tutor training courses.

results.title: Teaching a language structure by the Australian situational method. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part 2 shows excerpts from the teaching of the interrogative and negative patterns, and the long and short answer forms of the verb “to have”. It again lays emphasis on the lesson steps of the situational method, and has a final sequence showing students at work in a language laboratory.
results.title_for_label: Teaching a language structure by the Australian situational method. Part 2
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
